sect2.title: Other Assessment Tools
sect2.para: It is important to remember that diagnostic information obtained during interviews should be reconciled with the client’s background and history, context, behavioral observations, and data from other assessment methods, including self-report questionnaires, self-monitoring, and informants. Gathering broad background data reduces the likelihood of omitting or neglecting information that might be critical for conceptualizing and/or treating the anxiety disorder.
